content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Iron Plate Production Area (Position x=0.0-4.0, y=0.0)
Consists of two stone furnaces producing iron plates:
- Stone furnace at (0,0) with coal fuel
- Stone furnace at (2,0) with coal fuel

###Copper Plate Production Area (Position x=4.0, y=4.0)
- Stone furnace producing copper plates with coal fuel

###Electronic Circuit Assembly Line (Position x=6.5-12.5, y=11.5)
Consists of:
- Input chest at (6.5, 11.5) storing iron plates
- Burner inserter at (7.5, 11.5) moving items from input chest to assembler
- Assembling machine at (9.5, 11.5) crafting electronic circuits
- Burner inserter at (11.5, 11.5) moving finished products
- Output chest at (12.5, 11.5) storing electronic circuits

###Power Generation System (Position x=-9.5 to -2.5, y=22.5-26.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) providing water
- Pipe network carrying water from pump to boiler
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5) converting water to steam
- Steam pipe network 
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5) generating electricity
- Electric pole network distributing power

###Science Pack Handling (Position x=0.5, y=28.5-31.5)
Consists of:
- Burner inserter at (0.5, 30.5)
- Storage chest at (0.5, 31.5) containing automation and logistic science packs

ERROR TIPS

### Assembler Resource Shortage Errors
- The assembling machine is consistently showing ITEM_INGREDIENT_SHORTAGE status
- Ensure proper supply chain of copper cables to the assembler

### No Ingredients Errors in Furnaces
- Some furnaces showing "no ingredients to smelt" warnings
- Maintain consistent ore supply to furnaces

### Entity Placement Coordination
- When placing connected entities (like pipes and power poles), ensure proper alignment and connections
- Verify connection points are valid before placing fluid-carrying entities

### Resource Management
- Monitor coal levels in burner inserters and furnaces to prevent fuel shortages
- Keep input chests stocked with required materials
